title: Redesign Seller Dashboard to match the provided Shopify-style screenshots (rebranded to Shanju)

requirements.text: Redesign the Seller Dashboard page UI (frontend/src/pages/SellerDashboardPage.tsx) to closely match the layout, spacing, and visual hierarchy of the two uploaded Shopify admin mobile screenshots, while allowing small visual differences and keeping all user-facing text in English.

quotes: সেলার ডাসবোর্ডে ডিজাইন স্ক্রিনশট দিয়েছে এরকম দেখে করে দিন... Shopify এর নামের জায়গায় Shanju নাম তাকবে
হ্যা করে দিন সামান্য পরিবর্তন হলে সমস্যা নাই করে দিন

acceptanceCriteria: Seller dashboard uses a mobile-first layout resembling the screenshots (top dark bar + main content cards/checklist style), with consistent spacing and card styling.
Dashboard remains fully usable on desktop (responsive) without broken layout.
No regression to existing seller dashboard capabilities: viewing store, opening store settings, and adding products still work.

requirements.text: Implement a Shopify-admin-like top header section within the Seller Dashboard content (not the global app Header) that matches the screenshots: a dark bar with a menu icon, a prominent search input, a notifications icon, and a circular user/store badge placeholder. This header must not change global navigation behavior outside the dashboard.

quotes: সেলার ডাসবোর্ডে ডিজাইন স্ক্রিনশট দিয়েছে এরকম দেখে করে দিন

acceptanceCriteria: SellerDashboardPage renders an internal dark top bar similar to the screenshots, independent of frontend/src/components/Header.tsx.
Search field is present visually; it may be non-functional (no backend/search feature required).
Icons and elements align correctly on common mobile widths (e.g., ~360px) without overflow.

requirements.text: Update the Seller Dashboard main content to follow the screenshot’s onboarding/checklist card pattern (e.g., ‘Add store name’, ‘Add your first product’, and additional setup cards), wiring CTAs to existing app actions: store name/settings must navigate to /create-store, and ‘Add product’ must open the existing ProductFormDialog. Any additional setup cards may be informational-only if no corresponding feature exists, but must look consistent and not break navigation.

quotes: আপনার ইচ্ছে মতো ডিজাইন করুন দেখতে যেনো সেইম মনে হয়

acceptanceCriteria: A prominent ‘Add store name’ (or equivalent) section exists and navigates to /create-store.
An ‘Add product’ CTA exists and opens the existing ProductFormDialog (same functionality as current ‘Add Product’ button).
Existing product list/management UI remains accessible from the dashboard (it can be placed lower on the page or behind a section), including edit, delete, and quick stock update.

requirements.text: Ensure the Seller Dashboard contains no visible occurrences of the brand name ‘Shopify’; replace any such visible copy with ‘Shanju’ where branding is needed. Keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: Shopify এর নামের জায়গায় Shanju নাম তাকবে

acceptanceCriteria: A UI text scan of SellerDashboardPage and any new dashboard-only components shows no visible ‘Shopify’ strings.
Any new branding labels shown in the dashboard use ‘Shanju’.
All newly added labels, headings, helper text, and button text are in English.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not introduce new backend endpoints or require backend schema/state changes for this redesign.
Keep existing data sources on the seller dashboard (useGetCallerSupplierProfile, useGetCallerSupplierProducts) and existing flows (ProductFormDialog, /create-store navigation).
nonGoals: Implementing real functionality for dashboard search, notifications, theme customization, shipping rates, or domain management (visual-only cards are acceptable).
Changing global authenticated header/navigation behavior across the rest of the app.
Adding new authentication methods (only Internet Identity remains).
